2D Textures (LowRes).Description: Low-resolution 2D texture images for BIM models to avoid large library files. Stored in the project BIM library; use for quick visualisations or placeholders.

3D Models Objects.Description: Library of 3D model object files/components for use in project BIM models. Located in the BIM library; includes standard model components for consistency.

3D Visualisation Objects.Description: Collection of 3D model files used for visualisation and rendering purposes. Downloaded for visualisation only; do not integrate into the main BIM model.

3DS/Lumion File.Description: 3D scene file for visualisations (e.g., 3ds Max or Lumion format) used in project renders. Typically stored on the visualiser server; coordinate with the visualisation team for access or updates.

Additional Fees approved.Description: Documents evidencing approval of additional service fees beyond the original contract. Refer to Additional Fees letter and change control.

Additional Fees calculations.Description: Spreadsheets or documents calculating additional fees for extra services or scope changes. Refer to Additional Fees letter and change control.

Additional Fees letter.Description: Letter correspondence regarding the agreement or proposal of additional fees.

Agenda (BB Produced).Description: Meeting agenda document created by Bond Bryan for project meetings. Internal version of the agenda; compare with any incoming agendas from external parties.

Agenda (Incoming).Description: Meeting agenda document received from an external party or consultant.

AI Generated visualisations.Description: Project visualisation images generated using AI tools or software. Bond Bryan internal imagery; use for concept presentations or design inspiration.

Audio Recording.Description: Audio file recorded for project purposes (e.g., meeting, interview, or site walkthrough). Internal audio record; transcribe or note key points for project documentation. does not replace meeting minutes.

Backup models (rvt/pln).Description: Backup archive of BIM model files (e.g., Revit or ArchiCAD models) saved at key milestones. Stored with project milestones; use for restoring or reviewing earlier design versions.

Balconies information.Description: Technical information, drawings, or specifications for balconies provided by a specialist. External subcontractor content; integrate relevant details into design coordination.

Bespoke rulesets (solibri).Description: Custom Solibri model-checking rulesets tailored for this project.

BIM BEP (draft BB produced).Description: Draft Building Information Modeling (BIM) Execution Plan produced by Bond Bryan. Internal draft version; review alongside the external draft and update for the final issue. Final version (agreed) in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

BIM BEP (draft external).Description: Draft BIM Execution Plan document provided by an external consultant or party. External draft; coordinate with Bond Bryan's draft to prepare the final agreed BEP. Final version (agreed) in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

BIM BEP (final).Description: Final Building Information Modeling (BIM) Execution Plan for the project. Official agreed version; supersedes all prior drafts and guides the project's BIM processes.

BIM Clash Rendition (BCF).Description: BIM clash issues file in BCF (BIM Collaboration Format) capturing model coordination problems. Use it to track and resolve clashes with other disciplines.

BIM other contractual documents (draft.Description: Draft version of other BIM-related contractual documents provided by an external party. Final version (agreed) in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

BIM other contractual documents (draft B.Description: Draft version of other BIM-related contractual documents prepared by Bond Bryan. Final version (agreed) in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

BIM other contractual documents (final).Description: Finalized BIM-related contractual documents for the project. Official versions; they supersede earlier drafts and form part of the contract.

BIM Project Protocol Standard (draft BB.Description: Draft project BIM protocol standard document prepared by Bond Bryan. Final version (agreed) in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

BIM Project Protocol Standard (draft ex.Description: Draft project BIM protocol standard document provided by an external party. Final version (agreed) in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

BIM Project Protocol Standard (final).Description: Final project BIM protocol standard outlining agreed BIM procedures and standards. Official approved protocol; all team members should adhere to this final version.

BIM Review.Description: Review document focusing on the project's BIM implementation or model quality. Internal BIM process review; use findings to improve model coordination and standards adherence. Ask BIMsupport for guidance if needed.

BIM Translators.Description: Configuration files or translator settings for BIM software (e.g., for IFC export/import). Stored in the project BIM library; use for consistent data exchange between software platforms.

BREEAM / LEED submission.Description: Submission documents for BREEAM or LEED certification, detailing sustainability compliance. Usually prepared by the sustainability consultant (external); include required reports and forms.

British Standard (project related).Description: British Standard publication relevant to the project (e.g., building code or guidance document). Over and above Building Regulations and Clients' issued contractual documents (ExternalDiscipline/X-Client).

Building Control Submission.Description: Documents submitted for Building Control approval, demonstrating regulatory compliance. Major milestone submission; ensure all required drawings and reports are included.

Building Control tracker (modified).Description: Modified version of the building control tracker updated by Bond Bryan to monitor compliance. Internal tracking document; use this to keep tabs on building control items and compare with the original (ExternalDisciplines/T-BuildingControl).

Building Control tracker (original).Description: Original building control tracker document, likely provided by the building control authority or client. External baseline tracker; reference this for official requirements and updates (modify and save in BondBryan/A-Architecture/L-List/4000-Trackers).

Calculations Parking.Description: Calculation sheet determining parking space requirements or counts for the project. Internal calculation; ensure it meets local parking standards and incorporate into site planning.

Calculations Toilets.Description: Calculation sheet determining the required number of toilets (sanitary fixtures) for the project. Internal calculation; verify compliance with building regulations and occupancy needs.

CDP drawings.Description: Contractor Design Portion (CDP) drawings provided by subcontractors for specialist elements. External technical drawings; coordinate these with the main design to ensure compatibility.

CEM Presentation.Description: Client Engagement Meeting. Bond Bryan internal presentation; refer to related meeting notes or context for full understanding.

Change Control.Description: Log or register documenting changes to the project scope or design and their approval status. Internal change tracker; update whenever a change is proposed or implemented.

Clash detection report.Description: Report detailing the results of clash detection runs between different discipline models. Use it to coordinate with consultants on resolving design conflicts.

COBie / Data client report.Description: COBie (Construction-Operations Building Information Exchange) data report prepared by the client Information Manager. Provided by the Information Manager (external); use it to align project data deliverables with client requirements.

Comments CDP / Subcontractors.Description: Review comments compiled by Bond Bryan on subcontractor (CDP) submissions. Ensure these comments are sent to the subcontractors with recorded dates and status.

Comments Designers' pack.Description: Review comments on design packages or submissions from the design team. Ensure these comments are sent to the subcontractors with recorded dates and status.

Compliancy Review.Description: Review document checking project compliance with specific standards or requirements. Internal compliance check; identify any issues to resolve for regulatory or client requirements.

Correspondence Record.Description: Record or log of project correspondence, including letters and official communications. To be read in conjunction with Change Control, Additional Fees approvals.

DEIR (modified).Description: Modified version of the Employer’s Information Requirements (EIR) document adapted by Bond Bryan. Internal working version of client requirements; ensure it reflects the original ExternalDisciplines/X-Client document

DEIR (original).Description: Original Employer’s Information Requirements (EIR) document likely provided by the client. External project requirements document; use as baseline for BIM and information delivery expectations. If modified save the new version to BondBryan/A-Architecture/L-List/1000-Programmes

Design and Access Statement.Description: Design and Access Statement explaining the design concept and site access, typically for planning. Prepared by Bond Bryan; required for planning submission to justify design decisions. Final version (when submitted) saved in 0_ProjectMilestones/Milestone-PlanningSubmission.

Design Guidelines (project related).Description: Project-specific design guidelines or standards document. Over and above Building Regulations and Clients' issued contractual documents (ExternalDiscipline/X-Client).

Design Responsibility Matrix.Description: Matrix defining the responsibility of each party for various design elements and deliverables. Contractual document; ensures clarity on roles and responsibilities across the design team.

Design Review.Description: Document summarizing discussions and outcomes of a design review meeting. Internal review record; use to implement agreed changes and track decisions.

Drawing Register.Description: Register listing all project drawings with details like numbers, titles, and revisions. Bond Bryan internal list; keep updated to manage drawing issues and revisions.

Drawings DWG Archive/Superseded.Description: Archive of superseded drawing files in DWG format. Bond Bryan drawing archive; refer to these only for historical information, not current use.

Drawings DWG Current Version.Description: Current set of drawing files in DWG format, representing the latest design versions. Active drawing set; use these for coordination and issuing to the project team.

Drawings DWG WIP/ToBeChecked.Description: Work-in-progress drawing files in DWG format awaiting checking or approval. Internal use only; finalize these to move them into the current issued set.

Drawings PDF Archive/Superseded.Description: Archive of superseded drawing files in PDF format. Historical record of issued drawings; ensure only current PDFs are used for reference.

Drawings PDF Current Version.Description: Current set of drawing files in PDF format for distribution and use. Latest issued drawings; rely on these for construction and coordination.

Drawings PDF WIP/ToBeChecked.Description: Work-in-progress drawing files in PDF format that are yet to be checked or issued. Draft drawings for internal review; do not circulate until finalized.

DTM Presentation.Description: Design Team Meeting, prepared for a specific meeting or purpose. Bond Bryan internal presentation; consult meeting context or minutes for relevance and prepare relevant Agenda prior to the meeting.

Duty of Care (draft).Description: Draft duty of care letter or document prepared before formal agreement. External draft (likely client-provided); final signed version in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

Duty of Care (signed).Description: Signed duty of care letter or agreement for the project. Official executed document; keep on record for compliance and reference.

Elements Schedules (windows, doors,…).Description: Schedules listing building elements (e.g., windows, doors, etc.) produced by BIM software.

Email saved (for record).Description: Saved email correspondence kept on file for project record-keeping. Bond Bryan internal archive; key communications saved here for accountability and reference. Not all emails need to be saved.

Fees approved.Description: Documents confirming the approval of the agreed project fees. Formal record of fee agreements; filed under project administration for reference.

Fees calculations.Description: Calculations or breakdown documents for the project fee structure. Internal breakdown of fees; use to calculate fees in line with Rapport3 workflows.

Fees letter.Description: Letter regarding project fees, such as a fee proposal or agreement letter. Official fee correspondence; maintain as part of the contract records.

File Note.Description: Internal file note documenting a conversation, decision, or instruction for record. Used to capture informal decisions; ensure important points are recorded for future reference.

Finishes schedule.Description: Schedule listing all finish materials (flooring, paint, etc.) and their specifications. Internal design schedule; coordinate with room data sheets and specifications.

Fire Engineer report.Description: Fire engineering report provided by the project's fire engineering consultant. External fire safety document; implement its recommendations and ensure code compliance.

H&S Designer Competence Assessment.Description: Assessment form evaluating the competence of designers from a health and safety (CDM) perspective. Complete for all design team members as per CDM requirements.

H&S Designer Risk Assessment.Description: Risk assessment focusing on design-stage health and safety considerations (CDM regulations). Internal CDM risk assessment; update as design evolves to address and mitigate risks.

Heat Loss Calculation Report.Description: Report analyzing building heat loss to inform thermal performance and insulation requirements. technical report with expertise from specialist; cross-check with M&E consultant data to ensure energy efficiency targets.

HRB submission.Description: Submission documents for a Higher-Risk Building (HRB) in line with new building safety regulations. Regulatory submission; coordinate closely with the building safety regulator and include all required details.

IFC Library.Description: Library of IFC (Industry Foundation Classes) files imported in BIM software. Delete old library files when not in use (only latest versions to be kept).

Images Precedent.Description: Collection of precedent images (reference photos or case studies) relevant to the project. Stored in the project library; use for design inspiration or to communicate ideas to the client.

Incoming Documents.Description: General incoming documents from external parties. External documents; sort and file these into appropriate discipline folders after review and save in renamed YYYY-MM-DD Description folder.

Incoming Drawings.Description: General incoming drawings from external parties. External documents; sort and file these into appropriate discipline folders after review and save in renamed YYYY-MM-DD Description folder.

Interior specific Documents (appointed).Description: Interior design documents produced by Bond Bryan interior design team (separately appointed).

Interior specific Drawings (appointed).Description: Interior design documents produced by Bond Bryan interior design team (separately appointed).

Interior specific Lists (appointed).Description: Interior design documents produced by Bond Bryan interior design team (separately appointed).

ITT Client Documentation.Description: Invitation to Tender documents provided by the client during pre-commission. External tender info from the client; includes project brief, requirements, etc., to guide Bond Bryan's bid.

ITT Drawings.Description: Drawings prepared by Bond Bryan for the Invitation to Tender package. Internal drawings for tender submission; ensure they meet client tender requirements.

ITT External Originals.Description: Original drawings or documents from external sources included in the tender package. External reference materials for tender; maintain these for completeness and clarification.

ITT Feedback and results.Description: Documents containing feedback and results from the tender process. Outcome of the tender stage; review to inform adjustments or negotiations.

ITT Report.Description: Report summarizing the Invitation to Tender process or submissions. Bond Bryan internal analysis; documents tender responses and recommendations.

ITT-Submission.Description: Submitted tender package documents for the Invitation to Tender. Final tender submission; archive this as the official bid sent to the client.

JCT Contract (draft).Description: Draft JCT (Joint Contracts Tribunal) construction contract prepared for review. Preliminary contract version; finalize terms and obtain signatures for the final contract. Final version (signed) in 0_ProjectAdmin/Contracts.

JCT Contract (final).Description: Final JCT (Joint Contracts Tribunal) contract document for the project. Signed construction contract; the binding agreement governing project delivery.

K10 Partitions.Description: Technical documents or specifications related to partition systems (labelled under code K10). Provided by a partitions subcontractor; integrate with architectural specifications and drawings.

Landscape Documents (appointed).Description: Landscape architecture documents produced by the Bond Bryan landscape architect (separately appointed).

Landscape Drawings (appointed).Description: Landscape architecture documents produced by the Bond Bryan landscape architect (separately appointed).

Landscape Lists (appointed).Description: Landscape architecture documents produced by the Bond Bryan landscape architect (separately appointed).

Letter of compliance.Description: Letter certifying compliance with specific requirements or regulations for the project. Bond Bryan correspondence; retain for record to demonstrate adherence to standards or conditions.

Lift information.Description: Technical information or specifications for lifts and escalators from the specialist supplier. External supplier data; incorporate into building design and coordinate with structural and MEP plans.

Logos.Description: Collection of project-related logos (client, consultants, etc.) in image format. For use in  presentations and BIM model; ensure only current official logos are used.

Method Statement.Description: Method statement document describing how a specific work task will be carried out safely and effectively.

MIDP.Description: Master Information Delivery Plan outlining all project information deliverables and responsibilities. Provided by the Information Manager (external); use to coordinate Bond Bryan's TIDP and overall deliverables.

Milestone Records (Drawings, reports, co.Description: Archive of documents (drawings, reports, contracts, etc.) compiled at each project milestone. Central milestone archive; review to track what was delivered at each stage.

Minutes (BB produced).Description: Meeting minutes documented by Bond Bryan summarizing discussions and actions.

Minutes (Incoming).Description: Meeting minutes received from an external party or consultant. External meeting record; cross-check with Bond Bryan's minutes to ensure consistent understanding.

Model Federated.Description: Federated BIM model combining all discipline models into one for coordination. Compiled by Bond Bryan; use for clash detection.

Model IFC (BB produced).Description: IFC (Industry Foundation Classes) model exported by Bond Bryan from the native design model. Internal IFC export; share with consultants and combine with incoming IFCs for coordination in 'Model Federated'.

Model IFC (incoming).Description: IFC model file received from an external consultant's design. External model input; import or reference it in the federated model and/or BIM model and verify alignment.

Model Native (rvt/pln).Description: Native BIM model files (e.g., Revit .rvt or ArchiCAD .pln) used for developing the design. Bond Bryan working models; keep versions archived and coordinate sharing as needed.

Other calculations.Description: Miscellaneous calculation documents or spreadsheets not covered by specific categories. Internal calculations; update and verify these as the design evolves.

Other comments.Description: General comment or review documents that do not fall under specific categories.

Other Contract documents (draft).Description: Draft miscellaneous contract documents prepared or provided before finalization. Likely client-issued drafts; review and revise before executing final copies.

Other Contract documents (final).Description: Finalized miscellaneous contract documents for the project. Official documents on file; reference these for any contract clarifications.

Other Reviews.Description: Miscellaneous project review documents not covered by specific review categories.

Other Schedules.Description: Miscellaneous schedules or lists that don't fit other specific categories.

Outsourcing Briefing.Description: Briefing document outlining tasks or scope to be outsourced.

Outsourcing Comments.Description: Comments or feedback related to outsourced work or externally produced content. Marked up drawings and documents.

Outsourcing Tracker.Description: Tracker for outsourced packages or tasks, monitoring their progress and status.

PDBR Documents (appointed).Description: Documents related to the Principal Designer (Building Regulations) role, compiled by the appointed team. Internal building regs compliance documentation; coordinate with any external PDBR documents if applicable.

PDBR Documents (external).Description: Principal Designer (Building Regulations) documents provided by an external consultant. External building regs compliance docs; ensure the internal team reviews and aligns with these.

PDBR Drawings (appointed).Description: Drawings focusing on building regulations compliance produced by the appointed Principal Designer. Internal compliance drawings; include these in the design set and coordinate with external PD if needed.

PDBR Drawings (external).Description: Drawings from an external Principal Designer (Building Regulations) focusing on compliance. External compliance drawings; confirm they are integrated into the project documentation.

PDBR Lists (appointed).Description: Lists or schedules (e.g., compliance checklists) maintained by the appointed Principal Designer (Building Regulations). Internal compliance lists; keep them updated and cross-reference with external lists if provided.

PDBR Lists (external).Description: Compliance lists or schedules from an external Principal Designer (Building Regulations). External compliance lists; verify all items are addressed in internal documents.

PDCDM Documents (appointed).Description: Documents related to the Principal Designer (CDM regulations) role, produced by the appointed team. Internal health & safety documentation; coordinate with external PD documents if the role is external.

PDCDM Documents (external).Description: Principal Designer (CDM) documents provided by an external party responsible for CDM duties. External CDM documents; ensure Bond Bryan reviews these to align with design processes.

PDCDM Drawings (appointed).Description: Drawings related to CDM (Construction Design & Management) considerations by the appointed team. Internal safety-related drawings; coordinate with external PD if one is appointed outside.

PDCDM Drawings (external).Description: Drawings focusing on CDM/safety provided by an external Principal Designer. External safety drawings; include in project info and ensure compliance with them.
Drawings focusing on CDM (safety) considerations provided by an external Principal Designer. External safety drawings; integrate these with project documents and address any safety issues.

PDCDM Lists (appointed).Description: Lists or schedules (like risk registers) created by the appointed Principal Designer under CDM. Internal PD CDM lists; update regularly and share with the team for compliance.

PDCDM Lists (external).Description: Lists or schedules from an external Principal Designer under CDM (e.g., risk assessments, registers). External H&S lists; ensure all items are tracked and addressed in project planning.

Photograph Existing.Description: Photographs of the existing site or structures taken before project work begins. Internal project photo record; use as a baseline to compare against construction progress and completion.

Photograph Post Completion.Description: Photographs taken after project completion, showing the finished building and site. Notify marketing team.

Pictures Site visit.Description: Photographs captured during site visits to document progress or issues. Internal site visit photos; use for progress reports and to record on-site conditions.

Planning consultation boards.Description: Display boards prepared for planning consultation events, showing project plans and information. Bond Bryan presentation materials; update these as the design evolves for public or stakeholder consultations.

Planning Submission and documents.Description: Documents compiled for the planning application submission (forms, drawings, reports). Submitted information, WIP drawings/documents to be saved elsewhere.

PQQ Client Documentation.Description: Pre-Qualification Questionnaire documents provided by the client during the pre-commission phase. External pre-commission info; outlines project basics and client requirements for initial bids.

PQQ Drawings.Description: Drawings prepared by Bond Bryan for the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire submission. Internal drawings for PQQ; ensure they address client requirements at this early stage.

PQQ External Originals.Description: Original drawings or documents from external sources used in the PQQ stage. External references in the PQQ; keep for completeness and as context for Bond Bryan's submission.

PQQ Feedback and results.Description: Documents containing feedback or results from the PQQ process (e.g., shortlist outcomes). Outcome of pre-qualification; use insights to improve for the tender stage.

PQQ-Submission.Description: Submitted Pre-Qualification Questionnaire documents (complete PQQ response package). Final PQQ submission; record of Bond Bryan's initial bid information.

Presentation Main file (Affinity).Description: Primary presentation document created in Affinity design software format. Original editable file; export to PDF when sharing with those without Affinity.

Presentation Main file (InDesign).Description: Primary presentation document created in Adobe InDesign format. Original editable InDesign file; used for high-quality layouts, export PDFs for distribution.

Presentation Main file (PowerPoint).Description: Primary presentation document created in Microsoft PowerPoint format. Editable PowerPoint file; convenient for client presentations and quick updates.

Product reference.Description: Reference document for a specific product (e.g., technical datasheet or brochure) used in the project. External product info from a supplier; refer to it when specifying or coordinating that product.

Programme (BB produced).Description: Project programme (schedule) developed by Bond Bryan outlining tasks and timelines. Internal project schedule; align it with any master programme provided by the client or PM.

Programme (incoming).Description: Project programme received from the client or external project manager. External master schedule; ensure Bond Bryan's activities align with these timelines.

Progress report.Description: Report detailing the progress of the project over a certain period. Bond Bryan progress update; share with the client and use to track against the programme.

Project Directory.Description: Directory of project contacts, listing key team members and their contact information. Keep this updated as personnel change - also on Rapport3 / external team.

RIBA Stage Completion.Description: Documents marking the completion of a RIBA work stage (deliverables compiled at stage end). Milestone records for each RIBA stage; archive these for reference and auditing.

Room Data Sheets (RDS).Description: Room Data Sheets (RDS) detailing requirements and specifications for each room/space. Internal project documents; update these as design details are finalized and verify with client requirements.

RVT Families.Description: Library of Revit family components (doors, windows, etc.) used in the project model. Stored in BIM library; ensure all team members use the approved families for consistency.

Sanitaryware schedule.Description: Schedule listing sanitary fixtures (sinks, toilets, etc.) and their specifications for the project. Internal schedule; coordinate with plumbing layouts and ensure items match the design. Bond Bryan produced document supplier information to be included in ExternalDiscipline/X-Subcontractors.

Schedule of accommodation.Description: Schedule of accommodation outlining all spaces/rooms and their areas against requirements.

Site visit report.Description: Report from a site visit, detailing observations, progress, and any issues noted. Bond Bryan site report; use to follow up on actions and inform the project team.

Sketch ideas.Description: Collection of sketch drawings and conceptual ideas for the project. Internal creative drawings; use these for brainstorming and early client discussions.

Specifications BB produced document.Description: Project specification documents produced by Bond Bryan. Produced in NBS Chorus, pdf record here only.

Specifications incoming doc.Description: Specification documents received from an external source (consultant or subcontractor). External spec content; integrate relevant sections into the project's overall specifications on NBS Chorus.

Stage Report.Description: Formal report summarizing the work completed and decisions made at a project stage. Bond Bryan deliverable; provides a record of design progress at that RIBA stage for the client.

Standards and guidance (outside of contr.Description: Standards and guidance documents relevant to the project but not part of the contract requirements.

Strategic Brief Development.Description: Document outlining the development of the project's strategic brief (high-level goals and needs).

Strategic Headcount List.Description: List detailing the anticipated headcount or occupancy numbers for strategic planning.

Strategic Investment appraisals and cost.Description: Documents evaluating strategic investment options and their costs for the project.

Strategic Options Development.Description: Documents exploring various strategic development options or design directions for the project.

Strategic Space Need analysis.Description: Analysis of high-level space requirements and needs for the project.

Structural engineer's Documents.Description: Documents from the structural engineering consultant, such as reports or calculations. External structural documentation; coordinate with architectural information for consistency.

Structural engineer's Drawings.Description: Drawings provided by the structural engineer detailing structural elements. External structural drawings; integrate with architectural drawings to avoid conflicts.

Structural engineer's Models.Description: Digital models (IFC format only) provided by the structural engineering consultant. Link or merge into the federated model for coordination.

Subcontractor information.Description: General information or documents provided by subcontractors (could include drawings, specs, etc.). External subcontractor content; ensure relevant info is extracted and filed appropriately in project documents.

Supporting images for reports / presenta.Description: Supporting images for reports or presentations in Affinity format (original editable images). Source graphics files; use when editing or creating high-quality visuals, and export as needed.
Supporting images for reports or presentations in common image formats (JPEG/PNG). Ready-to-use images; insert into documents or slides as needed, original editing done in source files.

Survey Cetopo file (2D/3D).Description: Topographical survey file (2D/3D format) of the site, imported from Cetopo. External survey data; use for site modeling and ensure coordinate system matches project settings.

Survey GoogleMap / orthophoto.Description: Site location imagery (Google Map screenshots or orthophotos) for contextual reference. External map images; use for initial site analysis and presentations, noting they are for reference only.

Survey Incoming.Description: Incoming survey documents or data from external sources.

Survey OS Map (2D).Description: Ordnance Survey map (2D) of the project area. Official mapping data; use as base for site plans and ensure usage complies with licensing.

Sustainability Carbon Assessments.Description: Documents assessing the project's carbon footprint or sustainable design performance. Bond Bryan internal sustainability documentation; coordinate findings with sustainability consultants.

Sustainability Project Briefing Document.Description: Document outlining the project's sustainability brief or objectives. Guides sustainable design decisions and aligns with client sustainability goals.

Sustainability Review.Description: Review document evaluating the project against sustainability targets or criteria.

Technical Review.Description: Technical review report examining the design for technical quality and compliance. Internal design QA/QC document; address any issues identified to maintain technical excellence.

Term of engagement (draft).Description: Draft version of the project's terms of engagement (contractual agreement) before signing. External draft (likely client-supplied); review and negotiate changes prior to signing the final version (0-ProjectAdmin/Contracts)

Term of engagement (signed).Description: Signed final terms of engagement document for the project. Official agreement on project services; refer to this for scope and conditions of appointment.

Thermal Bridging.Description: Report or analysis focused on thermal bridging and insulation performance in the design. Requires expert documentation..

TIDP.Description: Task Information Delivery Plan detailing specific information deliverables and who provides them. Bond Bryan's plan; aligns with the Master Information Delivery Plan (MIDP) to schedule information outputs.

Transmittal Sheet.Description: Transmittal sheet form recording details of documents issued to other parties. Internal record to accompany document issues; use to track distributions and acknowledgments.

Twinmotion file.Description: 3D visualisation scene file in Twinmotion format for rendering and animation. Internal visualisation content; update as the model changes and use for creating walkthroughs.

Video.Description: Project-related video file (e.g., site video, or meeting recording). Internal video content; store large files appropriately and compress if needed for sharing.meeting recording does not replace formal minutes

Visualisation files export.Description: Exported visualisation files (models or scenes) for use in external applications or sharing.

Visualisation files native.Description: Native visualisation project files (original format scenes) used for creating renders.

Visualisation Output Images.Description: Rendered image outputs produced from the project's visualisation process. Final still images for presentations; organize these for easy access during meetings or submissions.

Visualisations Output Video.Description: Rendered video output (animated walkthroughs or fly-throughs) from the project's visualisations. Final visualisation videos; use for client presentations and ensure file sizes are manageable for sharing.
